availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert T. Glass (Henderson County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of Owen Glass and Elizabeth H. Glass. Married Sophronia B. Alves Glass in Henderson County on September 4, 1860. Student in Henderson County in 1850. Household owned thirteen enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1850. Graduated from Centre College in Danville, Kentucky, in 1853. Served in the Henderson County State Guard as third lieutenant from May 24, 1859. Attorney in Henderson County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Henderson County in 1860. Household owned an additional thirteen enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1860. Attorney in Henderson County in 1863.

Centre College Catalogue, (Danville, KY, 1864), 24.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Henderson County, KY, July 1863, p. 18, p. 405 of 629 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Edmund L. Starling, History of Henderson County, Kentucky (Henderson, Kentucky, 1887), 202, 744.
